Quick navigation
My Hardware (Example) 0. Download & Create Installation Media 1. Boot & Network 2. Partitioning 3. Filesystem Formatting & Mounting 4. Stage3 & chroot 5. Portage & Mirrors 6. USE Flags & Licenses 7. Profile Selection 8. Localization 9. Kernel 10. fstab 11. GRUB 12. Networking 13. Wayland / X11 14. GPU & Microcode 15. Desktop Environments 16. Users & sudo 17. SSH 18. Reboot FAQ References ğŸ’» My Hardware (Example) # CPU: AMD Ryzen 9 7950X3D (16C/32T) Motherboard: ASUS ROG STRIX X670E-A GAMING WIFI RAM: 64GB DDR5 GPU: NVIDIA RTX 4080 SUPER + AMD iGPU Storage: NVMe SSD Dual boot: Windows 11 + Gentoo Example only. Steps apply to most x86_64 hardware.
0. Download & Create Installation Media # Official mirror list: https://www.gentoo.org/downloads/mirrors/
Use a mirror close to your region (e.g., Taiwan NCHC, AARNET Australia, Kernel.org global). 0.1 Download ISO (example: NCHC Taiwan) # wget https://free.nchc.org.tw/gentoo/releases/amd64/autobuilds/current-install-amd64-minimal/install-amd64-minimal.iso 0.2 Create USB Install Disk # Linux (dd):
sudo dd if=install-amd64-minimal.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M status=progress oflag=sync Replace sdX with your USB device.
Windows (Rufus): https://rufus.ie/
Select USB & ISO Choose dd mode Start 1. Boot & Network # 1.1 Check UEFI / BIOS # ls /sys/firmware/efi Exists â†’ UEFI; else â†’ Legacy BIOS.
1.2 Wired Network # ip a dhcpcd eno1 ping -c 3 gentoo.org 1.3 Wiâ€‘Fi # wpa_supplicant:
iw dev wpa_passphrase "SSID" "PASSWORD" | tee /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf wpa_supplicant -B -i wlp9s0 -c /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf dhcpcd wlp9s0 ping -c 3 gentoo.org iwd (recommended):
emerge net-wireless/iwd systemctl enable iwd systemctl start iwd iwctl [iwd]# device list [iwd]# station wlp9s0 scan [iwd]# station wlp9s0 get-networks [iwd]# station wlp9s0 connect SSID 1.4 (Optional) Temporary SSH (root password login) # Purpose: let you continue installation remotely (copy/paste long commands, keep session stable, work from another machine). This is for the live install environment only; disable later.
Set a root password (if not already): passwd Allow root login & password auth (temporary; appends to the end of config): echo "PermitRootLogin yes" >> /etc/ssh/sshd_config echo "PasswordAuthentication yes" >> /etc/ssh/sshd_config Start SSH daemon (live ISO uses OpenRC): rc-service sshd start Find the IP: ip a | grep inet From your workstation: ssh root@<INSTALLER_IP> Security note: After finishing the base install (inside your new Gentoo system), edit /etc/ssh/sshd_config to tighten (remove the two lines or set PermitRootLogin prohibit-password) and restart sshd.
(Continue below with partitioning.)
2. Partitioning (lsblk and cfdisk) # Check disks:
lsblk -o NAME,SIZE,TYPE,MOUNTPOINT Example output:
nvme0n1 476G disk â”œâ”€nvme0n1p1 512M part â”œâ”€nvme0n1p2 1G part â”œâ”€nvme0n1p3 100G part â””â”€nvme0n1p4 375G part Optional editor:
cfdisk /dev/nvme0n1 Suggested layout (UEFI):
Size FS Mount Purpose 512M FAT32 /efi UEFI ESP 1G ext4 /boot kernel, initramfs 100G+ ext4/XFS/Btrfs / root Rest ext4/XFS/Btrfs /home user data 3. Filesystem Formatting & Mounting (ext4 / XFS / Btrfs) # 3.1 Format # ext4:
mkfs.ext4 -L root /dev/nvme0n1p3 mkfs.ext4 -L home /dev/nvme0n1p4 XFS:
mkfs.xfs -L root /dev/nvme0n1p3 mkfs.xfs -L home /dev/nvme0n1p4 Btrfs (force overwrite with -f if needed):
mkfs.btrfs -L rootfs /dev/nvme0n1p3 mkfs.btrfs -L home /dev/nvme0n1p4 # Force: mkfs.btrfs -f -L rootfs /dev/nvme0n1p3 3.2 Mount # ext4 / XFS:
mount /dev/nvme0n1p3 /mnt/gentoo mkdir -p /mnt/gentoo/{boot,home,efi} mount /dev/nvme0n1p4 /mnt/gentoo/home mount /dev/nvme0n1p2 /mnt/gentoo/boot mount /dev/nvme0n1p1 /mnt/gentoo/efi Btrfs with subvolumes:
mount /dev/nvme0n1p3 /mnt/gentoo btrfs subvolume create /mnt/gentoo/@ btrfs subvolume create /mnt/gentoo/@home umount /mnt/gentoo mount -o compress=zstd,subvol=@ /dev/nvme0n1p3 /mnt/gentoo mkdir -p /mnt/gentoo/{boot,home,efi} mount -o subvol=@home /dev/nvme0n1p3 /mnt/gentoo/home mount /dev/nvme0n1p2 /mnt/gentoo/boot mount /dev/nvme0n1p1 /mnt/gentoo/efi 4. Download Stage3, Mount System Directories & chroot # 4.1 Stage3 Choice # Use standard Stage3 (glibc), with OpenRC or systemd. â€œdesktopâ€ builds exist but are optional; prefer standard + correct profile. 4.2 Download & Extract # cd /mnt/gentoo links https://www.gentoo.org/downloads/mirrors/ tar xpvf stage3-*.tar.xz --xattrs-include='*.*' --numeric-owner 4.3 Mount System Directories # OpenRC:
mount -t proc /proc /mnt/gentoo/proc mount --rbind /sys /mnt/gentoo/sys mount --rbind /dev /mnt/gentoo/dev systemd:
mount -t proc /proc /mnt/gentoo/proc mount --rbind /sys /mnt/gentoo/sys && mount --make-rslave /mnt/gentoo/sys mount --rbind /dev /mnt/gentoo/dev && mount --make-rslave /mnt/gentoo/dev mount --rbind /run /mnt/gentoo/run && mount --make-rslave /mnt/gentoo/run 4.4 Enter chroot # chroot /mnt/gentoo /bin/bash source /etc/profile export PS1="(chroot) $PS1" 5. Portage & Mirrors (with full make.conf example) # 5.1 Sync Portage # emerge-webrsync emerge --sync 5.2 Choose Mirrors # Interactive:
emerge --ask app-portage/mirrorselect mirrorselect -i -o >> /etc/portage/make.conf Manual (keep only one):
echo 'GENTOO_MIRRORS="https://free.nchc.org.tw/gentoo/"' >> /etc/portage/make.conf 5.3 /etc/portage/make.conf Example # COMMON_FLAGS="-march=native -O2 -pipe" MAKEOPTS="-j32" EMERGE_DEFAULT_OPTS="--ask --verbose --with-bdeps=y --complete-graph=y" GENTOO_MIRRORS="https://free.nchc.org.tw/gentoo/" USE="wayland egl pipewire vulkan" # USE="X xwayland egl pipewire vulkan" VIDEO_CARDS="nvidia" # VIDEO_CARDS="amdgpu radeonsi" # VIDEO_CARDS="intel i965 iris" # VIDEO_CARDS="nouveau" ACCEPT_LICENSE="*" 6. USE flags & Licenses (Beginner Solutions) # 6.1 Check USE # emerge -pv firefox 6.2 Add USE safely # echo "media-video/ffmpeg X wayland" >> /etc/portage/package.use/ffmpeg 6.3 Add License # echo "www-client/google-chrome google-chrome" >> /etc/portage/package.license 6.4 Keywords (optional newer versions) # echo "www-client/google-chrome ~amd64" >> /etc/portage/package.accept_keywords 7. Profile Selection (Desktop / Server) # eselect profile list Examples:
KDE + systemd â†’ default/linux/amd64/23.0/desktop/plasma/systemd GNOME + systemd â†’ default/linux/amd64/23.0/desktop/gnome/systemd Desktop + OpenRC â†’ default/linux/amd64/23.0/desktop Server â†’ default/linux/amd64/23.0 Apply & update:
eselect profile set <id> emerge -avuDN @world 8. Localization (Language & Timezone) # Locales:
en_US.UTF-8 UTF-8 en_AU.UTF-8 UTF-8 locale-gen eselect locale set en_US.utf8 Timezone:
ls /usr/share/zoneinfo echo "Australia/Melbourne" > /etc/timezone emerge --config sys-libs/timezone-data List of timezones
9. Kernel Selection & Compilation (Full Commands) # Prebuilt (recommended):
emerge sys-kernel/gentoo-kernel-bin Firmware (linux-firmware) license unblock + initramfs USE # To ensure bundled firmware and early firmware loading (via initramfs):
Unblock licenses (adds redistributable/no-source-code acceptance for this package): echo "sys-kernel/linux-firmware linux-fw-redistributable no-source-code" >> /etc/portage/package.license Enable initramfs USE flag (so firmware is packed for early loading): echo "sys-kernel/linux-firmware initramfs" >> /etc/portage/package.use/microcode Install firmware (do this before (or after) installing/updating kernel): emerge --ask sys-kernel/linux-firmware (Rebuild kernel or regenerate initramfs afterward if already installed.)
Manual compile:
emerge sys-kernel/gentoo-sources cd /usr/src/linux make menuconfig make -j"$(nproc)" make modules_install make install Initramfs (if using Btrfs, LUKS, RAID, modular drivers):
Dracut: emerge sys-kernel/dracut dracut --kver "$(ls /lib/modules | sort -V | tail -1)" Genkernel: emerge sys-kernel/genkernel genkernel initramfs 10. Generate fstab (ext4 / Btrfs examples) # blkid lsblk -f ext4:
UUID=<UUID-ESP> /efi vfat noatime,umask=0077 0 2 UUID=<UUID-BOOT> /boot ext4 noatime 0 2 UUID=<UUID-ROOT> / ext4 noatime 0 1 UUID=<UUID-HOME> /home ext4 noatime 0 2 Btrfs:
UUID=<UUID-ESP> /efi vfat noatime,umask=0077 0 2 UUID=<UUID-ROOT> / btrfs noatime,compress=zstd,subvol=@ 0 1 UUID=<UUID-ROOT> /home btrfs noatime,compress=zstd,subvol=@home 0 2 11. Install Bootloader GRUB (with os-prober) # emerge grub efibootmgr grub-install --target=x86_64-efi --efi-directory=/efi --bootloader-id=Gentoo emerge --ask sys-boot/os-prober echo 'GRUB_DISABLE_OS_PROBER=false' >> /etc/default/grub grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg If root uses Btrfs:
emerge --ask sys-fs/btrfs-progs 12. Enable Networking (OpenRC / systemd) # systemd:
emerge net-misc/networkmanager systemctl enable NetworkManager OpenRC:
emerge net-misc/dhcpcd rc-update add dhcpcd default 13. Wayland / X11 Choice & USE # Wayland:
USE="wayland egl pipewire vulkan" X11:
USE="X xwayland egl pipewire vulkan" 14. GPU Drivers & CPU Microcode # NVIDIA Proprietary:
VIDEO_CARDS="nvidia" emerge x11-drivers/nvidia-drivers Nouveau (open source):
VIDEO_CARDS="nouveau" emerge x11-base/xorg-drivers AMD:
VIDEO_CARDS="amdgpu radeonsi" emerge mesa vulkan-loader Intel:
VIDEO_CARDS="intel i965 iris" emerge mesa vulkan-loader CPU microcode (Intel):
emerge sys-firmware/intel-microcode 15. Desktop Environments (Optional) # KDE Plasma:
emerge kde-plasma/plasma-meta x11-misc/sddm x11-base/xwayland systemctl enable sddm GNOME:
emerge gnome-base/gnome gnome-base/gdm systemctl enable gdm 16. Users & sudo # passwd useradd -m -G wheel,audio,video,usb -s /bin/bash zakk passwd zakk emerge app-admin/sudo echo "%wheel ALL=(ALL) ALL" >> /etc/sudoers âš ï¸ Replace zakk with your own username.
17. SSH (Optional) # emerge net-misc/openssh systemctl enable sshd && systemctl start sshd 18. Reboot # exit umount -R /mnt/gentoo reboot ğŸ’¡ FAQ # Slow downloads â†’ choose nearest mirror. Wiâ€‘Fi WPA3 unstable â†’ try WPA2. Wayland vs X11 â†’ AMD/Intel: Wayland; Compatibility: X11. NVIDIA â†’ new cards proprietary driver; old cards â†’ nouveau. USE conflicts â†’ check emerge -pv and add to package.use. License blocks â†’ add to package.license. Need newer versions â†’ use package.accept_keywords. Btrfs + LUKS/RAID â†’ initramfs recommended. ğŸ“ References # Gentoo Handbook: https://wiki.gentoo.org/wiki/Handbook:AMD64/Full/Installation Bitbili: https://bitbili.net/gentoo-linux-installation-and-usage-tutorial.html Rufus: https://rufus.ie/ Timezones: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones
